Show HN: An Open Source Alt Text Twitter Bot
text:
I've been maintaining a Twitter bot providing a number of tools around image descriptions AKA alt text for a bit. It has overlapping sets of commands for both tagging and DMs, the list of which are in the pinned tweet.

The bot is primarily used for OCR of posted images to provide a retweetable version with alt text, but other commands such as AI image description and searches of the alt-text.org library are becoming more common.

The code is available on GitHub, and is MIT licensed: https://github.com/alt-text-org/AltTextCrew

Ask HN: How to guide contractor to properly use Git branches and pull requests?
text:
I work on a side project with paid contractors. One in particular is very skilled with our target platform but I am spending lots of time trying to coach him on proper use of Github. He submits PRs that have lots of weird merging issues [1] that are too complicated to unpack and I end up creating new branches to cherry pick his contributions manually.

Has anyone faced this situation with contributors before? Is there a reliable 30 min guide for how to use branches and PRs for someone who is "just not getting it" so far?

https://imgur.com/a/xNu8RLr

Ask HN: Reverse engineering whirpool.net.au into a F/OSS web app
text:
Whirlpool (AKA WP), is a very popular tech 'forum' in Australia / Nz.

For an overview of it's arch, see here: https://whirlpool.net.au/wiki/wp_architecture

And these 2 links lead off to just about anything else related to the service: https://forums.whirlpool.net.au https://whirlpool.net.au/wiki

For those unfamiliar, there's a tonne of great enduser features (inc. a very powerful userscript called wp+).

I'd love to rebuild it all into a modern FOSS web app, one that uses just html/css/js etc, instead of java.

With it's own unique UX/UI, but one that still hints-at or feels, a lot like WP.

Interested in folks thoughts on how best to approach this.
